title: Adult Gymnastics Class
description:
We’re offering Adult Gymnastics Classes for the 18\+ crowd!

Adult Gymnastics classes occur every Tuesday 5:00 PM to 6:30 PM & Friday from 6:30 PM to 8:00 PM.

$20 per person, OR pay for a whole 8-week session in advance through our site. You can attend on Tuesday, Friday, or both!

Please bring the class fee in cash at the time of arrival. This can be a DROP IN, so there is no need to sign up online before coming!

If you’ve ever wanted to try out gymnastics or get back into it in adulthood, now is your chance! During our adult classes, open to all genders, our coaches will move at the pace of each student, helping them achieve goals they set for themselves. No experience is necessary to be involved in this class, so this is a great opportunity to learn the basics and get some exercise, no matter what age you are! Try out our trampoline, bars, beam, and other gym equipment in a safe and supportive environment. You can build strength and increase your range of motion while having fun like you’re a kid again.

Ask our coaches what you can work on between classes, and they’ll help personalize your training!

Please wear something comfortable and keep long hair tied back. Skirts and restrictive clothing are not recommended. You must remove your shoes before going onto the mat or using equipment. Please let us know if you have any physical limitations or health conditions that may interfere with doing certain motions. We recommend bringing a water bottle.

You can email us for more info or join our mailing list at: info@sonomagymnasticsacademy.com

title: Intermediate Salsa Class
description:
This class is designed for dancers who have a solid grasp of the basics and are eager to expand their repertoire with more complex and fluid movements.

Pre- requisite:

Salsa Class Beginners

Each week, we’ll break down a new move, focusing on the technique and connection that will make you a more confident and stylish dancer. We’ll go beyond the foundational steps to cover a wide range of essential intermediate patterns and styling, including:

Turns and Spins:

Master your inside and outside turns, double spins, and the elegant 360 and Hand Toss moves.

Intricate Patterns:

Learn to execute the 360, wrap, as well as various Cross Body Lead variations like the U-Turn and Spiral.

Footwork and Styling:

Enhance your rhythm and flair with advanced footwork like the Suzy Q, Front Tap, and Mambo Step. We’ll also work on styling with a wrap and improving your posture and upper body movement.

This class is your chance to refine your technique, improve your lead-follow connection, and add a variety of fun and dynamic moves to your salsa vocabulary. Join us and elevate your dance!

Details:

No partner necessary — rotations ensure everyone gets to dance.

Please wear non-marking shoe soles to protect the floor.

Arrive 10 minutes early to warm up and get settled.

Date & Time: Tuesdays @ 6:30PM – 7:30PM

title: The Walker Roaders at Little Saint
location: 25 North St, , Healdsburg, CA, 95448, United States
description: The Walker Roaders bring their high-energy Celtic-punk sound to Little Saint. The supergroup features James Fearnley of The Pogues, Grammy-winning producer and former Flogging Molly member Ted Hutt, and Marc Orrell of Dropkick Murphys. Formed in the U.S., the trio released their self-titled debut album in 2019, blending traditional instruments like accordion, mandolin, and banjo with driving rock elements.    Rooted deeply in the Celtic-punk tradition, their music spans rousing anthems and powerful ballads, showcasing both grit and melody. With decades of combined experience across influential bands and productions, The Walker Roaders deliver a dynamic live performance that honors the genre’s heritage while pushing it forward. Don’t miss this electrifying night of music at Little Saint.

title: Bachata with ALEX
description:
Bachata with ALEX

Ready to take your bachata to the next level?

This intermediate bachata class is for dancers who have already mastered the basics and are ready for a new challenge. We’ll build on your foundation with a focus on more intricate footwork, technique, and partner work.

Advanced turn patterns and combinations

Styling and body movement to add flair to your dancing

Musicality to connect with the rhythm and emotion of the music

Feeling comfortable with your basic bachata steps and ready for more?

Our intermediate bachata class is designed for dancers who want to elevate their skills. We’ll move beyond the fundamentals to focus on more complex technique, footwork, and partner work.

This class will help you:

Refine your leading and following

Learn combinations and techniques

Develop your personal style and musicality

If you’re ready to add some fire to your dancing, this is the class for you!

Important Details

Basic steps and turns required. We’ll be moving into combinations, so a solid grasp of your basic steps is essential.

No partner necessary: Come solo or bring a friend—either way, you’ll have plenty of opportunities to dance.

Please wear non-marking shoe soles: This helps us keep our dance floor in great condition.

Come join us and discover the joy of bachata! We can’t wait to see you on the dance floor.

title: Jewish Course in Novato Explores Dreams, Astrology, and the Evil Eye
description:
NOVATO, CA — Chabad Jewish Center of Novato is launching a new fascinating 4 week class: Jewpernatural: Signs, Spirits, and Superstition in Jewish Belief, a new four-week course from the beginning Monday, February 24.

The course addresses questions many people are asking today: Do dreams have meaning? Is there such a thing as destiny? What does Judaism say about astrology and the “evil eye”? How does Jewish tradition understand souls and the afterlife?

Drawing on Talmud, Jewish philosophy, and Kabbalah, Jewpernatural offers a grounded, thoughtful approach to topics that often generate curiosity, skepticism, and uncertainty.

The four sessions include:

Dreams & Direction

Stars & Signs

Jinx & The Evil Eye

Para & Normal (souls, angels, spirits, and the afterlife)

“People are curious about these topics, but they also want serious, authentic answers,” said Rabbi Menachem Landa of Chabad Jewish Center of Novato. “This course helps participants separate myth from meaning and gain practical Jewish perspective for real life.”

The course is open to all, regardless of background or prior Jewish learning.

Event Details What: Jewpernatural (4-weekcourse) When: Begins Monday, February 24 Where: Chabad Jewish Center of Novato Format: In person and Zoom Registration: Jewishnovato.com/Jewpernatural Contact: info@Jewishnovato.com

title: March Month of Flowers Challenge
description:
**Starting March 1st begins the "March Month of Flowers Challenge" (online).**

Create an art piece related to the prompt.

Be inspired and give inspiration to others.

**Only $5**, so everyone can join and share in this creative adventure!

***March Month of Flowers* Challenge** is here to give you a creative outlet, some structure, and respite from your brain. 

When you pick up a brush, pen, or pencil (thread, clay, fabric…), your brain gets a rest and becomes more alive and flexible. The world around you becomes more alive; you pick up on shades, details, and patterns all around you. Your intuition gets stronger. And fear lessens, anxiety fades, and curiosity grows. You stop worrying about making mistakes, and instead, you find the freedom to simply create

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?* art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU’s Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?* is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit’s core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU’s Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU’s Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9–March 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of bonsai and the season’s first flowers. Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year’s all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai—trees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot bonsai take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal—reminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through Hanami Strolls—guided walks through the Garden’s Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

title: Beginning Watercolor Class
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Discover the joy of Watercolor Painting!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‘wet on wet’ watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

title: Art Exhibit: Celebrating Women
description:
Date: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE  2/13/26

**MARCH EXHIBIT: CELEBRATING WOMEN**

EXHIBIT DATES:  February 23 – March 29, 2026

**RECEPTION: SATURDAY, MARCH 7, 2026, 4-6 pm: Join in to meet the artists and celebrate the show. Take part in the Gallery’s free monthly drawing for a beautiful work by a Gallery artist.  Refreshments will be served.**

Sonoma County artist, **Tosya Shore,** presents **Celebrating Women,** paintings that commemorate women in honor of Women’s History Month. Shore’s watercolor works capture women in their element, showing the multiple facets of their lives.  These dynamic paintings break away with strong shapes and interlacing patterns that draw the viewer in exciting ways.  A la Degas, we catch a ballet dancer lacing her shoes in “Good Point.”  The artist takes us into nature with “Redwood Rendezvous” where dominant trunk shapes frame a couple enjoying a glorious forest scene.    “Just Back from Vegas” captures a fleeting view of elegance as the woman in question catches her breath.  “There’s such special feeling in these everyday moments, I love to turn the mundane into magic – women deserve nothing less,” noted Shore. 

Meet the artist: Shore will be hosting the Gallery on March 5 and 19 from 11am to 6 pm.

 The Stairway Smallworks Showcase features **Donna Schaffer’s Ooh La La, Plein Air,** a collection unveiling oil paintings made on her recent trip to France.  Roaming the streets of Paris, toting paints and palette, Schaffer captured iconic scenes buzzing with “la belle vie.” The viewer catches a true cultural vibe in “Café le Bistro”, the site of a favored hangout for espresso and conversation.  One is awed by the structure rising from the ground-level trees in Schaffer’s unique view of the Eiffel Tower in “Paris is for Lovers.” “Every day was an adventure in Paris – I hope through these plein air vignettes, to share the excitement of being there”, stated Schaffer.

Meet the artist: Schaffer will be hosting the Gallery on March 21 and 22 from 11am to 6 pm.

Upstairs Art Gallery, 306 Center Street, Healdsburg, CA 95448. (707) 431-4214.: OPEN DAILY: 11am – 6 pm.    **www.upstairsart gallery.net** 

For further information: Contact: Beverly Bird, Press Contact, at bvdrio@sonic.net or 707-799-1490.

description:
Explore the heart and soul of winemaking with our Grape to Glass Tour & Tasting at Dutton Estate Winery. Immerse yourself in the world of wine as you stroll through our chardonnay vineyard, rooted in six generations of farming legacy in the heart of the Russian River Valley. Witness firsthand the art and passion behind our winemaking process with an exclusive tour of our modest crush pad and barrel room. Relish with a tasting of five current releases and a special library wine, accompanied with a curated cheese and charcuterie board, and finished with decadent artisanal chocolates. title: Maija Peeples-Bright: Life is Just a Bowl of Terriers
description: Maija Peeples-Bright is one of the few women artists associated with Northern California's Funk Art movement of the late 1960s and '70s. Peeples-Bright's wildly inventive practice comprises robust compositions bustling with animals of all kinds-her "beasties" as she calls them-forming surreal, imaginative landscapes in audacious impasto. Her zoological arrangements represent alternate realities, infusing exuberance and a sense of the absurd into impossible scenarios. Highly distinctive, her textural creature patterns revel in the extreme, often taking up every inch of the canvas, multiplying her beasties into dizzying arrangements. Peeples-Bright invites us into a decadence-gone-wild world all her own. The exhibition will feature a retrospective look at Peeples-Bright's career, from her early days of the Funk Movement to today.

title: Next-Level Drawing
description:
Schedule

Wednesday, March 11 – April 22, 2026 11:00 AM – 1:00 PM

Location

Room 208

Experience Level

Intermediate

Drawing & Painting

Age\(s\)

18 and older

$225 – Registration CostAdvance your drawing skills with deep study of composition, value, and technique. Strengthen your creative process through focused practice.

About the Class

In this class, we will explore composition, value, and other aspects of drawing but on a deeper level. Beginning drawing classes have a lot of ground to cover so the concepts are skimmed over in order to give you exposure to as many as possible. Next-level drawing takes the time to do a deeper dive into some of the principles of drawing. When drawing we use limited tools which allow us to isolate both our strengths and weaknesses. Using this opportunity to really investigate our own process will serve to strengthen all aspects of our creative work. Drawing can be a challenge but when you see how it enhances the creative process, you will know it is worth it. This class is suitable for students who have a basic understanding of drawing and want to work on their skills. Please bring the following materials to class: 20″ x 26″ drawing board with clips, 18 “x 24” Strathmore drawing pad \(other brands are fine as long as the paper is drawing quality\), soft willow charcoal, compressed charcoal \(Char-kole brand black\), white plastic eraser, notebook, Staedtler drawing pencils 2B and 6B, Pigma micron pens black \(one fine-tip and one medium-tip\).Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any class purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

Research shows there are everyday habits you 

can build today to help protect your memory and 

thinking as you get older - even reducing your 

risk of cognitive decline and possibly dementia.

brain-healthy habits.

title: Quench at Copia: “GOAT”-ed Grapes- Chardonnay Edition
description:
CIA at Copia is proud to be the home of the newest wine tasting experience and podcast series, *Quench at Copia,* with Master Sommelier Andrea Immer Robinson. You will get to be part of a live studio audience through a guided tasting with special guests from the culinary and wine industries who will join along the way. Each event invites you to learn and connect through exceptional wines, thoughtful pairings, and lively conversation.  

Why does Chardonnay taste so different from place to place—and why does limestone matter so much? Find out at a live, in-person tasting during CIA at Copia’s *Quench at Copia* series led by Master Sommelier Andrea Immer Robinson with special guest and legendary winemaker, David Ramey. In this experience, you’ll be focusing on one of the “GOAT”-ed Grapes: Chardonnay! You’ll explore standout Chardonnay styles side by side, paired with bites designed to amplify flavor and texture. Expect “aha” moments, lively conversation, and great white wine.

title: Sweet and Savory Tamales: Traditional Techniques
description:
Schedule

Wednesday, March 18, 2026 5:00 PM – 8:00 PM

Experience Level

All Levels

Bilingual, Culinary Arts

Age\(s\)

18 and older

$100 – Registration CostMaster traditional tamal-making with sweet and savory variations. Learn masa preparation, filling techniques, and steaming methods for authentic results.

What you’ll do

Dive into the rich tradition of tamal-making in this comprehensive hands-on class exploring both sweet and savory variations of this beloved Latin American dish. Whether you’re new to tamales or looking to refine your technique, you’ll gain confidence in every step of the process from preparing masa to achieving perfectly steamed results. Learn to work with masa dough, understanding the proper texture and consistency that creates light, tender tamales. You’ll prepare savory fillings that might include seasoned pork, chicken with salsa verde, cheese with peppers, or black bean and vegetable options. Explore sweet variations featuring cinnamon, fruit, chocolate, or traditional piloncillo for dessert-style tamales that are perfect for celebrations or breakfast. Master the art of spreading masa evenly on corn husks, portioning fillings appropriately, and folding techniques that ensure your tamales hold together beautifully during steaming. You’ll learn the secrets of proper steaming for consistent cooking and discover tips for making large batches ahead for freezing. Tamales are central to celebrations and family gatherings across Latin America, and this class honors that tradition while making the process approachable for home cooks. Leave with recipes, techniques, and the skills to host your own tamalada.Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any class purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

Age\(s\)

A continuation of our intermediate course, this upper level / advanced course will help you hone your throwing skills in the studio.

What you’ll Create

This session is designed for people who have already taken multiple wheel throwing courses. A continuation of our intermediate course, this upper level / advanced course will help you hone your throwing skills through more complex demos, and nuanced approaches to technical throwing. In this 8 week course, students will dive deep into developing their own unique voice as they build a technical toolset for the independent maker. In addition to throwing, surface decoration techniques will be explored as well as the opportunity to experiment with different clay bodies. With your 8 week class registration, students receive the opportunity to purchase a studio pass for ½ off during the duration of their class. Sign ups for membership will be included in your preclass email.

Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

Our Adult Beginner Tap Class is the perfect place to let loose, learn the basics, and enjoy the rhythm of tap dance.

About the class

Ready to make some noise and have some fun? Our Adult Beginner Tap Class is the perfect place to let loose, learn the basics, and enjoy the rhythm of tap dance — no experience necessary! Each week, you’ll learn a brand-new mini routine that combines classic steps with modern flair. Whether you’re dancing for the first time or returning after years away, this class is designed to be accessible, upbeat, and full of energy. Come for the tap, stay for the laughs, and leave feeling empowered \(and a little more rhythmic than before\). Lace up your tap shoes – it’s your time to shine! Note: If you do not have tap shoes, you can wear socks to the class.

Hosting the night is KJ Danny D (Danny Duclos)—one of the most popular and in-demand karaoke hosts around. title: March Month of Flowers Challenge
description:
**Starting March 1st begins the "March Month of Flowers Challenge" (online).** 

You'll receive a list of prompts for every day in March. 

Create an art piece related to the prompt.

Share in our private Facebook group.

Be inspired and give inspiration to others.

**Only $5**, so everyone can join and share in this creative adventure!

***March Month of Flowers* Challenge** is here to give you a creative outlet, some structure, and respite from your brain. 

When you pick up a brush, pen, or pencil (thread, clay, fabric…), your brain gets a rest and becomes more alive and flexible. The world around you becomes more alive; you pick up on shades, details, and patterns all around you. Your intuition gets stronger. And fear lessens, anxiety fades, and curiosity grows. You stop worrying about making mistakes, and instead, you find the freedom to simply create

title: Marin Farmers Markets
description:
Price: Free

Sponsor: Marin Center

Explore the bounty of summer at the Marin Farmers Markets. Taste vine-ripened tomatoes, corn that was picked that morning, and peaches so juicy you have to bend over just to get a bite. Farm-fresh eggs, grass-fed beef, artisan c heeses, raw milk, and freshly baked breads complete the shopping exper ience. Specialty prepared foods and handmade art add to the magic of the market.

Enjoy the intimate feeling of the Thursday Marin Farmers Market, an ideal place to meet for lunch and pick up fresh produce for the weekend. Discover the abundance and diversity of product at the celebrated Sunday Marin Farmers Market, the third largest farmers market in California. Turn your dollar into a vote for local sustainable agriculture, shrink your eco-footprint, and revive the feeling of being intimate ly connected to your food by meeting your farmers face-to-face. The market takes place rain or shine.

www.aginstitutemarin.org

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9–March 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of bonsai and the season’s first flowers. Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year’s all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai—trees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot bonsai take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal—reminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through Hanami Strolls—guided walks through the Garden’s Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

title: Art Exhibit: Celebrating Women
description:
Date: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE  2/13/26

MARCH EXHIBIT: CELEBRATING WOMEN

EXHIBIT DATES:  February 23 – March 29, 2026

RECEPTION: SATURDAY, MARCH 7, 2026, 4-6 pm: Join in to meet the artists and celebrate the show. Take part in the Gallery’s free monthly drawing for a beautiful work by a Gallery artist.  Refreshments will be served.

Sonoma County artist, Tosya Shore, presents Celebrating Women, paintings that commemorate women in honor of Women’s History Month. Shore’s watercolor works capture women in their element, showing the multiple facets of their lives.  These dynamic paintings break away with strong shapes and interlacing patterns that draw the viewer in exciting ways.  A la Degas, we catch a ballet dancer lacing her shoes in “Good Point.”  The artist takes us into nature with “Redwood Rendezvous” where dominant trunk shapes frame a couple enjoying a glorious forest scene.    “Just Back from Vegas” captures a fleeting view of elegance as the woman in question catches her breath.  “There’s such special feeling in these everyday moments, I love to turn the mundane into magic – women deserve nothing less,” noted Shore. 

Meet the artist: Shore will be hosting the Gallery on March 5 and 19 from 11am to 6 pm.

 The Stairway Smallworks Showcase features Donna Schaffer’s Ooh La La, Plein Air, a collection unveiling oil paintings made on her recent trip to France.  Roaming the streets of Paris, toting paints and palette, Schaffer captured iconic scenes buzzing with “la belle vie.” The viewer catches a true cultural vibe in “Café le Bistro”, the site of a favored hangout for espresso and conversation.  One is awed by the structure rising from the ground-level trees in Schaffer’s unique view of the Eiffel Tower in “Paris is for Lovers.” “Every day was an adventure in Paris – I hope through these plein air vignettes, to share the excitement of being there”, stated Schaffer.

Meet the artist: Schaffer will be hosting the Gallery on March 21 and 22 from 11am to 6 pm.

Upstairs Art Gallery, 306 Center Street, Healdsburg, CA 95448. \(707\) 431-4214.: OPEN DAILY: 11am – 6 pm.    www.upstairsart gallery.net 

For further information: Contact: Beverly Bird, Press Contact, at bvdrio@sonic.net or 707-799-1490.

title: Expressive Portraits
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

To enroll please call or text Suzanne at 707-888-2083

Witness firsthand the art and passion behind our winemaking process with an exclusive tour of our modest crush pad and barrel room. title: Barbies & Bags Workshop
description:
Schedule

Sunday, February 15, 2026 1:00 PM – 4:00 PM

Location

Room 201, Fiber Arts Studio

Experience Level

All Levels

Kids, Programming, Sustainability

Age\(s\)

All Ages are welcome to attend Children under 16 must be accompanied by an adult

$25 – One Bag or Doll Entry $40 – Two Bags or Dolls entryTransform plastic dolls and create upcycled bags from trash into unique art. Join our hands-on Trashion workshop for the Gallery 212 Exhibit and Auction.

About the Class

This hands-on workshop invites participants to rescue and reinvent plastic dolls \(Barbies, Kens, and dolls that are under 12 inches\) often destined for landfills, where they can take 20 to 500 years to decompose. As part of Trashion Season, join us for the beloved Gallery 212 Exhibit and Auction \(April 3 – 25\) where discarded materials are transformed into small-scale works of art for a good cause. Together, we’ll reclaim these forgotten figures and reimagine them as expressive, one-of-a-kind artworks for submission to the gallery exhibit and auction. New this year: Bags! In addition to dolls, we’re expanding the exhibit to include bags—think totes, clutches, cross bagsm fanny packs, coin purses, and backpacks. Just like the Trashion runway, the only rule is that your piece must be made from unconventional materials and/or upcycled/used textiles. Participants will have access to access to sewing machines, hot glue guns, irons, hair dryers and other creative tools as well of a wide selection of trash and upcycled materials to bring their vision to life. BYOT \(Bring your own trash\) is also welcome and encouraged! The workshop registration is your application fee to the gallery exhibit! Come play, experiment, and collaborate while contributing to a dynamic gallery exhibit that raises funds for Sonoma Community Center programming through the auction. It’s a joy to see your art find a new home—and to be part of a creative community turning trash into treasure.

Thank you to Recology Sonoma-Marin for donating Barbies & Dolls for our gallery exhibit every year.

description:
Join us at Encaustic Open Studio, a monthly workshop designed for you to refine your encaustic painting skills under the guidance of knowledgeable instructor Susan Heeringa Piper. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced artist, this is the perfect opportunity to immerse yourself in the captivating world of encaustic art.

Encaustic painting is an ancient technique that involves using molten beeswax and pigments to create stunning, textured masterpieces. This unique medium allows for endless possibilities, as it can be layered, carved, scraped, and fused to create mesmerizing effects and depth. From ethereal landscapes to abstract creations, encaustic painting offers a truly immersive and tactile experience. 

Bring your own substrate or project to work on, or start something new!

From Collin:

I am a psychotherapist and guide whose work weaves together spirituality, nature-based practices, psychedelic therapy, and recovery. My path has been shaped by a foundation in existential philosophy and psychology, medicine circles, and a lifelong study of contemplative and esoteric traditions. Out of my own longing for community and a commitment to the needs of the moment, I am passionate about creating spaces for men to gather in honesty, vulnerability, and authenticity — places where we can face our struggles, share our truths, and remember the healing power of connection.

title: Marty O'Reilly
description:
There’s something about Marty O’Reilly’s music that feels like it’s always been here—like an old story being told in a new way. His voice is raw and real, his guitar playing gritty and soulful. It’s music that doesn’t try to be anything other than honest, and that’s exactly why it hits so hard.

He pulls inspiration from the roots of Americana; his sound references folk greats like Woody Guthrie, blues legends like Howlin’ Wolf,  gospel pioneers like Sister Rosetta Thorpe, and master storytellers like Tom Waits. It’s a sound that captivates and connects audiences, and leaves them wanting more.

His live shows aren’t just concerts—they’re cathartic experiences. One moment it’s soft and haunting, the next it’s wild and electric. The kind that stay with you long after the lights come up.

But it’s not just about the sound. Marty’s songs dig deep into the human experience—loneliness, connection, love, loss. Whether it’s an intimate solo set or a full band show, he makes every audience feel like they’re part of the story.

Over the years, Marty has built a dedicated following through relentless touring and staying true to his craft. He’s shared the stage with artists like Shakey Graves, St. Paul & The Broken Bones, Sarah Jarosz, and Alice O’Donovan and played at festivals like Bottlerock, SXSW, and High Sierra Music Festival, but his focus has always been on making music that means something.

Marty has poured everything into his music—spending years on the road, self-funding his albums, and navigating the ups and downs of life as an independent artist, husband, and father. But through it all, he’s never lost sight of why he started: to make honest music that connects.

If you’re looking for music that feels real, that makes you stop and listen, Marty O’Reilly is someone you need to hear.

title: Samba no Pé - First Class
description:
Get ready to feel the rhythm and energy of Rio de Janeiro! Samba no Pé \(Samba in the Foot\) is the captivating solo style of samba danced in the streets and at Carnival, known for its rapid, intricate footwork and infectious hip movements.

You will learn

The Basic Step: You will master the signature quick-quick-slow rhythm that defines Samba no Pé.

Arm & Hip Styling: You will learn how to add the authentic flair, movement, and energy that makes Brazilian samba so captivating.

Technique & Posture: You will receive tips on proper body alignment to help you dance longer, faster, and more safely.

Rhythm & Musicality: You will learn how to connect your movement directly to the irresistible beat of the bateria \(the samba drum section\).

This class is perfect for anyone looking to connect with the vibrant spirit of Brazil, improve coordination, and get a fantastic workout—all while learning the foundational steps of this iconic dance. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

Date & Time: Thursdays @6:30PM – 7:30PM

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

title: Forró Dance with Eric and Abigail
description:
Get ready to connect, spin, and glide to the irresistible rhythms of Forró! Originating in the Northeast of Brazil, Forró is a captivating partner dance known for its close embrace, playful steps, and infectious, feel-good music. It is a social dance that will enrich your life, perfect for a night out or a casual gathering.

You Will Learn:

The Basic Step & Close Embrace: You will master the foundational quick-quick-slow rhythm and learn how to comfortably and confidently navigate the essential close-hold connection that defines Forró.

Leading & Following Techniques: Discover the clear, subtle body cues required to effortlessly lead your partner through turns and variations, and how to follow with grace and responsiveness.

Traveling & Stationary Patterns: Learn fundamental steps like the ‘Caminhada’ \(walking step\) and common stationary turns that will allow you to dance on any size floor.

Rhythm & Musicality: Connect your movement to the distinct musical styles of Forró—from the mellow ‘Xote’ to the faster, more energetic ‘Pé-de-Serra.’

This class is perfect for anyone looking to learn a social partner dance, connect with Brazilian culture, and enjoy a vibrant, community atmosphere. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

Class Details

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

Date & Time: Thursdays @7:30PM – 8:30PM

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

When you pick up a brush, pen, or pencil (thread, clay, fabric…), your brain gets a rest and becomes more alive and flexible. The world around you becomes more alive; you pick up on shades, details, and patterns all around you. Your intuition gets stronger. title: Oakmont Meets Imagination - 52 Years of Creativity
description:
This year’s show will feature the work of more than 50 members of the Oakmont Art Association, showcasing a rich and diverse collection of fine art. Visitors can expect to see original works in acrylic, oil, pastel, watercolor, fiber art, and photography, many of which will be available for purchase. The exhibition highlights the wide range of styles, techniques, and personal visions represented by Oakmont’s artists, making each year’s show a fresh and inspiring experience.

In addition to fine art, the show will include a lively Artisan Marketplace. Artisans will offer an array of handcrafted items, including jewelry, photography, assemblage art, fiber and fabric pieces, original books, pottery, fused glass, and many other unique small works. These one-of-a-kind creations make perfect gifts and provide an opportunity to support local artists directly.

The event is designed to be both engaging and festive. Attendees can enjoy live music by Oakmont musicians and appetizers while browsing the exhibits and visiting with artists. A popular highlight of the show is the annual raffle, which adds an extra element of excitement while supporting a meaningful cause. In 2025 more than 50 raffle prizes were generously donated by local businesses.  Raffle drawing and wine reception occurs at 3:30 p.m. Saturday.

Proceeds from the raffle benefit Art Quest, an organization that supports Santa Rosa students who are pursuing education and careers in the arts. The generosity of past attendees has made a real impact—the 2025 raffle raised $3,200 for Art Quest, helping to foster creativity and opportunity for young artists in our region.

The Oakmont Art Association invites the community to attend this special event, celebrate 52 years of creativity, and experience the imagination, skill, and passion of its artists.

title: Painting Flora and Fauna in Watercolor
description:
Schedule

Fridays, March. 20- April 24, 2026 10:00 AM – 1:00 PM

Location

Room 208

Experience Level

All Levels

Drawing & Painting

Age\(s\)

18 and older

$275 – Registration Cost $25 – Materials Fee $300 – Total Registration CostIn this six-week course, participants will learn a unique approach to watercolor, intended to alleviate the frustration that many experience when learning this beautiful yet challenging medium.

About the Class

In this six-week course, participants will learn a unique approach to watercolor, intended to alleviate the frustration that many experience when learning this beautiful yet challenging medium. We will focus on strengthening one’s observational drawing skills, giving the artist a foundation off of which to build their paintings in a step-by-step layering process that trains the artist to see value and color. Our subject matter will be flora and fauna – a sampling of plants and animals. These subjects are great for beginners and experienced artists alike; their organic shapes make them forgiving drawing subjects, but their beauty can be a muse for life.  Instructor Hannah Day is a passionate nature lover and watercolorist and will share her unique approach to rendering botanicals and animal portraits in watercolor. This class will work both from photographs and from life, practicing observational drawing in addition to watercolor technique. With six class sessions, participants will have the opportunity to develop their skills and build muscle memory with a medium that often feels like it has a mind of its own.  This class is open to artists of all skill levels. All materials are provided.

title: Art Exhibit: Celebrating Women
description:
Date: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE  2/13/26

MARCH EXHIBIT: CELEBRATING WOMEN

EXHIBIT DATES:  February 23 – March 29, 2026

RECEPTION: SATURDAY, MARCH 7, 2026, 4-6 pm: Join in to meet the artists and celebrate the show. Take part in the Gallery’s free monthly drawing for a beautiful work by a Gallery artist.  Refreshments will be served.

Sonoma County artist, Tosya Shore, presents Celebrating Women, paintings that commemorate women in honor of Women’s History Month. Shore’s watercolor works capture women in their element, showing the multiple facets of their lives.  These dynamic paintings break away with strong shapes and interlacing patterns that draw the viewer in exciting ways.  A la Degas, we catch a ballet dancer lacing her shoes in “Good Point.”  The artist takes us into nature with “Redwood Rendezvous” where dominant trunk shapes frame a couple enjoying a glorious forest scene.    “Just Back from Vegas” captures a fleeting view of elegance as the woman in question catches her breath.  “There’s such special feeling in these everyday moments, I love to turn the mundane into magic – women deserve nothing less,” noted Shore. 

Meet the artist: Shore will be hosting the Gallery on March 5 and 19 from 11am to 6 pm.

 The Stairway Smallworks Showcase features Donna Schaffer’s Ooh La La, Plein Air, a collection unveiling oil paintings made on her recent trip to France.  Roaming the streets of Paris, toting paints and palette, Schaffer captured iconic scenes buzzing with “la belle vie.” The viewer catches a true cultural vibe in “Café le Bistro”, the site of a favored hangout for espresso and conversation.  One is awed by the structure rising from the ground-level trees in Schaffer’s unique view of the Eiffel Tower in “Paris is for Lovers.” “Every day was an adventure in Paris – I hope through these plein air vignettes, to share the excitement of being there”, stated Schaffer.

Meet the artist: Schaffer will be hosting the Gallery on March 21 and 22 from 11am to 6 pm.

Upstairs Art Gallery, 306 Center Street, Healdsburg, CA 95448. \(707\) 431-4214.: OPEN DAILY: 11am – 6 pm.    www.upstairsart gallery.net 

For further information: Contact: Beverly Bird, Press Contact, at bvdrio@sonic.net or 707-799-1490.

title: Adult Gymnastics Class
description:
**We’re offering Adult Gymnastics Classes for the 18+ crowd!**

**Adult Gymnastics classes occur every Tuesday 5:00 PM to 6:30 PM & Friday from 6:30 PM to 8:00 PM.**

**$20 per person, OR pay for a whole 8-week session in advance through our site. You can attend on Tuesday, Friday, or both!**

**Please bring the class fee in cash at the time of arrival. This can be a DROP IN, so there is no need to sign up online before coming!**

If you’ve ever wanted to try out gymnastics or get back into it in adulthood, now is your chance! During our adult classes, open to all genders, our coaches will move at the pace of each student, helping them achieve goals they set for themselves. **No experience is necessary** to be involved in this class, so this is a great opportunity to learn the basics and get some exercise, no matter what age you are! Try out our trampoline, bars, beam, and other gym equipment in a safe and supportive environment. You can build strength and increase your range of motion while having fun like you’re a kid again.

Ask our coaches what you can work on between classes, and they’ll help personalize your training!

Please wear something comfortable and keep long hair tied back. Skirts and restrictive clothing are not recommended. You must remove your shoes before going onto the mat or using equipment. Please let us know if you have any physical limitations or health conditions that may interfere with doing certain motions. We recommend bringing a water bottle.

You can email us for more info or join our mailing list at: info@sonomagymnasticsacademy.com

title: Online: Resilience & the Open Heart: Somatic Practices for Everyday Stress
description:
with Pawan Bareja, PhD

When we are out of alignment with our deepest heart values, life feels stressful. Whether the trigger is personal heartbreak, economic pressure, relational conflict, or the weight of the climate crisis, the body often reacts with anxiety, collapse, anger, or overwhelm long before the mind can make sense of it. You are invited to move from stress to love by transforming these patterns through embodied heart practices.

Each week, we will begin by gently noticing where activation lives in the body. We’ll then engage in embodied heart-opening practices to soothe the nervous system and reconnect with inner clarity. After practice, we will re-check the nervous system to observe what has shifted, revealing resilience as something softly felt, measurable, and trainable.

As the heart opens and the body softens, many experience deeper rest, clearer thinking, a renewed sense of connection to loved ones, and the courage to live a more meaningful life.

title: A Night with National Geographic Urban Ecologist Dr. Chris Schell
description:
**A Night with National Geographic Urban Ecologist Dr. Chris Schell**

**Friday, March 20**

**EcoLab Theater at CIA Copia, Napa CA**

**Doors: 5:30 PM | Program 6:00 PM**

Think wildlife lives “somewhere else”? Think again. Join National Geographic Explorer Dr. Chris Schell for a mind-expanding journey into the surprising world of urban coyotes, foxes, raccoons — and the hidden histories that shaped the ecosystems right outside our doors.

Dr. Schell’s groundbreaking work uncovers how environmental injustice, resilience, and human choices ripple through entire cities, transforming the animals who live alongside us. You’ll never see a neighborhood stroll the same way again.

A powerful, eye-opening evening for anyone curious about science, justice, and the wild stories unfolding in our own backyard.

**Be curious.  Be surprised.  Be there.**

BUY TICKETS 
After four successful tours across the US, Colombian Latin-mariachi-pop singer, songwriter, and producer Carlos Daniels is back with Más Vivo Que Nunca  – Juan Gabriel Tribute (More Alive Than Ever), a spectacle that thousands of fans across the nation are waiting for. 
Known as one of the best interpreters of El Divo De Juarez’s music, Daniels has conquered fans’ hearts with impressive performances at renowned venues, including five shows at the House of Blues Mandalay Bay Casino in Las Vegas. On this new tour, Daniels, along with a Mariachi band, is determined to touch your soul by reviving some of Gabriel’s greatest hits, while delivering an unforgettable performance. Más Vivo Que Nunca – Juan Gabriel Tribute will bring you a sea of emotions and memories, promising they will keep you singing along to every tune from the beginning until the end of the show. 


 

THIRD PARTY RESELLERS

description:

March 21, 2026
10:30 - 3:30
Location: Santa Rosa
Fee: $95.00
We know March has arrived when daffodils start springing up from the earth. Like trumpeters, they are announcing winter is over and spring is here! Even after they have fallen to the ground heavy from rain, they muster up the strength to once again stand tall. Come join this class and capture their cheerful, bright spirit using colored pencil. Class will include demonstrations, exercises, techniques and hands-on drawing time. All levels are welcome. Instruction will be structured in a way that will address the needs of the attendees.
Materials list to be mailed once registration and payment is received.
To register, please contact Victoria at kochergi@sonic.net mailto:kochergi@sonic.net or (707) 479-3336.
Victoria A. Kochergin is a professional botanical artist who works both with colored pencil and acrylics. Her artwork has been exhibited in solo and group shows in galleries, wineries, botanical gardens, international shows and on Alcatraz. She is a member of the American Society of Botanical Artists and the Northern Society of Botanical Artists. For more information about Victoria, please visit her website at http://www.victoriakochergin.com/

title: Corks Squared!
description:
Sonoma County Women's Wine Club (SCWWC)
Wine Cork Art

SAVE YOUR CORKS LADIES!

We are hosting a special event in March, on Saturday the 21st at our old favorite, K Squared Cellars. Local artist Tara Dickinson will be leading us as a group through creating a cork board masterpiece.

Event fee ($45) includes artist instruction and your personal cork art piece, invite your friends to join us! Please bring all those corks you have saved and don't quite know what to do with. If you don't have any, that's fine too. Let us know in the comments section so we can bring extra.

Vino is made available by K Squared for a separate fee *(by the flight or glass)*. The owner, Andrew, will be on hand to serve wine and entertainment.

About the Cellars: After spending his first 9 years in the wine industry at Charles Krug Winery in St. Helena, Andrew Moore developed a passion for crafting small lot, premium wines. In 2010, with a "the wine glass is half full" type of attitude, Andrew's plans for owning his own winery began with a single barrel of Russian River Pinot Noir produced at home.

In 2015 K Squared Cellars acquired winery and tasting room space. That single barrel of Pinot Noir and a dream of having their own family winery was realized!

About the Artist: Tara Dickinson is our artist and instructor. She has a background in fine arts and years of teaching expressive art labs to all ages. She enjoys sharing tools to help everyone feel comfortable in the creative process while learning new techniques. She moved to Santa Rosa in late 2021 after growing up mostly in FL and is loving the California lifestyle.

Wear your artsy clothing, bring your thirst, and corks for this 2-3 hour event.

* Pre-payment *(via Venmo, Zelle, or PayPal)* is required for this limited availability event. **[PLS REGISTER/PAY HERE!](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdHYNFReJbhlLGQh0_wl4dEJZlF3E4nmEobQzB2W93XO7tz9g/viewform?usp=publish-editor)**
* Maximum of 20 people, **guests welcome.**
* We suggest dressing warmly or in layers as the cellar will be a bit cold at this time.

The event starts promptly at 1:30 pm.
Please be a little bit early to get settled in with your wine and supplies. Tara will follow up with everyone who RSVP's 'Yes' to complete payment through her above link.

We look forward to seeing you all for this fun event in March!
Cheers!
\- Joleen and Dai

title: Clover Sonoma Family Fun Series: The Pout-Pout Fish by TheaterWorksUSA
description:
Back to All Shows


Clover Sonoma Family Fun Series
The Pout-Pout Fish 
by TheaterWorksUSA


Sunday, March 22, 2026

3:30 pm


BUY INDIVIDUAL TICKETS 
Can the poutiest fish frown turn upside down? Find out in this extraordinary musical, featuring whimsical puppets and live performers in a sweeping oceanic adventure. When Mr. Fish sets out on a quest to find Miss Clam’s missing pearl, he discovers there is more to him than his permanently plastered pout. Dive into this colorful adaptation of The New York Times bestseller, co-conceived, directed, and designed by the acclaimed puppeteers of AchesonWalsh Studios, whose work was featured in Broadway’s The King And I, On the Town and Radio City’s New York Spectacular. The writing team includes New Victory LabWorks Residency recipients Christopher Anselmo, Jared Corak, Matt Acheson, and Fergus Walsh. 
Recommended for ages 3-8, however, you know your child best. 
Run Time: 50 minutes 
Lap passes available day of the show, in-person at the ticket office for ages 2 and under. 

LBC performance may not include pieces from above video. 
 
Family Fun in the Lobby
Starting one hour before each performance, please join us in the lobby for fun art projects uniquely developed for each show. It’s a fun, free way for adults and children alike to get creative, while enhancing your enjoyment of the show. We also have pizza, beverages, and snacks available, all priced with a family’s budget in mind!   


VIPs Meet the Cast
Subscription holders be sure to stick around after the show to meet the cast and get autographs! (Except The Peking Acrobats®.) 

 Family Fun Series – Save 20% and see all 5 shows!
See the full series here: Clover Sonoma Family Fun Series 



Timeline

New Subscriptions go on sale for Members beginning June 24; General Public, June 27.
Individual Tickets go on sale for Members beginning August 19; General Public, August 22.

Two ways to buy! Season ticket packages are available online or by downloading the form (linked below) and sending the completed form to us by mail or email. If you have any questions, call the Patron & Member Services Office at 707.546.3600. 

Purchase New Subscription ONLINE
Download New Subscription Form 
 

THIRD PARTY RESELLERS
Don’t get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. Plus, we’re not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.

title: Watercolor Fundamentals Part 1
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Anne Millett

This is a 6-class series, meeting 6 Tuesdays
10:30AM-1:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$270.00


*Additional: Separate $20.00 plus tax Materials Fee paid to Anne at the first class, for the high-quality Arches #140 cold press watercolor paper. Brushes, palettes, high-quality watercolor paint, and set-ups for use during class will be provided.*

There will be a materials fee of $15 plus tax for the series.


Watercolor Fundamentals - Part 1

This class focuses on the simple delight of mixing color with water, brushing it on paper, and watching what happens as it moves and dries. You will learn easy ways to create paintings that are all about color and the sometimes unpredictable nature of water.

No drawing skills are needed.

In this class we will explore the basic principles of watercolor painting. Learn or refresh your understanding of brush handling, brush care and setting up, the benefits of “good paper”, watercolor lights and darks, flat and graded washes, wet-on-wet techniques such as charging, wet-on-dry techniques such as glazing, color wheel, color theory, color mixing, and more. Simple applications of these techniques invite you to experiment and play.

This class is designed for adults 18+

$270 for 6 classes, 2.5 hours each class
Payable via check, cash, or Zelle.

*Brushes, palettes, set-ups, and paint will be provided.*


To see Anne's work and to learn more about this class, please visit her website at: http://www.miraaster.com https://www.miraaster.com/ www.miraaster.com


To register for this workshop, please contact Anne by email at: classes@miraaster.com mailto:classes@miraaster.com mailto:amillett@gmail.com

location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
Out of Stock
      
    




Intro to Peaceful Pottery: 03/25- 4/22, 2026

  
    
      
        
          $250.00
        
      
    
  

Wednesdays, March 25 - April 22, 2026 (6 sessions); 6pm-8:30pmClass fee: $210 + Materials fee: $40Ages 16 and upAll levels welcome (beginner to advanced)Intro to Throwing and HandbuildingThis is a great class for those who want to enjoy building something with their own hands and experience the personal benefits of working with clay. Instruction will cover the basics of wheel throwing, hand-building (slab, coil, freeform), and glazing techniques. Students will also have unstructured time to work on their own creations.The class will explore the benefits of letting go of the need to be productive and "perfect". The main goal of this course is to familiarize students with how clay rooms work and why they’re a fun place to be.About the Instructor: Alice Rathjen has over 40 years experience working with clay. She was a production potter for five years. The current focus of her “art” is the sheer pleasure of playful engagement with clay. She enjoys throwing exquisite bowls, mugs and cups and seeing them go on adventures.

title: The Art of Acrylics
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson
Wednesday, Ongoing
10:00AM-12:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$30.00 per class

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We’ll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

title: Beginning Watercolor Class
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Discover the joy of Watercolor Painting!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‘wet on wet’ watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

Join us and experience the satisfaction of producing your own watercolor masterpieces. Register now and save with our early registration discount!

For more information or to register for this class, please contact Eva at: evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com

You can also visit Eva's website at: http://evamautner.com http://evamautner.com evamautner.com

Let's make beautiful art together!

title: Meet the Author: Emilly Prado, "Funeral For Flaca"
description: Emilly Prado is an award-winning writer, multidisciplinary artist, and speaker whose work examines identity, the systems that shape our lives, and the power of storytelling across mediums. The author will share the evolving nature of finding her path as a writer, drawing upon her experiences as a first-generation Chicana and college student, and self-proclaimed troublemaker who struggled with school and mental health. Attendees will hear a reading from Funeral for Flaca and view archival childhood photographs to better understand the author and how she found strength through music and writing. Followed by a Q&A session.  For more information, visit: https://events.santarosa.edu/womxns-history-month-2026 (https://events.santarosa.edu/womxns-history-month-2026)

title: Upcycled Journal Workshop — Sebastopol Center For the Arts, California
location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
Upcycled Journal Workshop: 03/26/26

  
    
      
        
          $70.00
        
      
    
  

Thursday, March 26, 2026; 6PM-9PM$60 + $10 Materials feeA fun and creative workshop turning a cereal/snack box into a unique handmade journal. Using scissors we will remove parts of the boxes until we have what we will use as our cover. Then using miscellaneous papers we fold these into the pages of our journals. With simple book-binding skills using a needle and waxed thread we will stitch the pages into our covers. We will also decorate the covers of our journals with collage papers and/or paint.Examples of completed journals will be shown and step by step instruction will be provided along with all supplies. Short exercises to boost your creativity, journal prompts, and a small gift from me are also included.Whether you are a beginning or seasoned artist/writer/crafter or just looking to try something new, this is a great way to get inspired and create something meaningful to you.About the Instructor: Rendell Hourigan received a BBA in Marketing from Texas Tech University, and has pursued art for over 25 years, focusing on sustainable mixed media. She has studied with artists including Chery Baird, Jenny London, and Teri Sloat, exploring drawing, collage, and soft pastels. Her training includes workshops and courses in art journaling, mosaics, and mark-making. She’s exhibited work at the Sebastopol Center for the Arts, The Graton Gallery, and her SOFA district studio. Drawn to the beauty of discarded materials and passionate about recycling, she incorporates reclaimed materials into her work and now leads art workshops to inspire eco-conscious creativity in others.

title: Expressive Portraits
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

To enroll please call or text Suzanne at 707-888-2083

title: THIRSTY THURSDAY New Member Social for Sonoma County Women's Wine Club
description:
Sonoma County Women's Wine Club (SCWWC)
This is our regular club meeting, held on the last Thursday of every month except for holidays and we are super excited! Come join us at 4th Street Cellars in downtown Santa Rosa. They have generously offered to host our monthly THIRSTY THURSDAY social for us.

If you are new to the area, or just looking to get out of the house and make new friends, this is the place for you. Welcoming to ALL new and (ahem, old) members.

Wine is purchased by the glass for a set fee of $13/$14 per glass with the variety of white, rosé, and red wines offered through 4th Street Cellars which includes tip. Fees are collected at the venue by Co-organizer Daima Phipps via cash, Venmo, or Paypal. You are welcome to purchase wine separately if you choose. Starting March 2025, we ask that every attending member pay a $1 "slush" fund fee per event so that we can build up our funds for club-related expenses, which can be paid by Venmo or cash.

There is no food offered, but you are welcome to bring an appetizer or snack to share with the group, and many ladies do. We will have time to socialize while tasting in the room upstairs to the left or the outside patio if the weather is nice.

The space has a 25 person attendee limit, but the list is open to 40 to eliminate a waitlist, and guests are welcome! Please RSVP below only if you are able to make it, we have an attendance policy: if you No-Show to three events, you may not attend events for the next three months. Please put this event in your calendar so you don't miss out or get dinged. A No-Show is when you are on the 'Going' list, but do not show up.

See you there, ready to kickoff!

title: Beginning Watercolor Class
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Discover the joy of Watercolor Painting!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‘wet on wet’ watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

Join us and experience the satisfaction of producing your own watercolor masterpieces. Register now and save with our early registration discount!

For more information or to register for this class, please contact Eva at: evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com

You can also visit Eva's website at: http://evamautner.com http://evamautner.com evamautner.com

Let's make beautiful art together!

title: Distant Voices: An Introduction to Asemic Writing — Sebastopol Center For the Arts, California
location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
Distant Voices: An Introduction to Asemic Writing

  
    
      
        
          $165.00
        
      
    
  

Saturday, March 28, 2026; 10am - 4pm$150 + $15 materials feeAsemic writing is the practice of creating artwork through marks that resemble handwriting, yet carry no literal meaning or readable text. It is the word before words form—the voice too distant to be understood—a cosmic expression without country or dialect.We’ll begin with a slideshow exploring the depth and range of asemic writing. Looking at ancient scripts, global languages, symbols, the calligraphic line, and the work of contemporary asemic artists, we’ll expand our understanding of what is possible.From there, you’ll begin your own asemic journey. These marks can infiltrate and transform your current artwork, or stand alone as independent works of art.Using ink and watercolor with a variety of tools, we’ll explore how to express what does not need to be said in words. My intention is to guide you toward authentic marks—marks that arise from the heart and move beyond casual scribbling into something deeply felt and uniquely your own. All levels welcome.About the Instructor: Sherrie Lovler holds a BA in Studio Art and has been teaching calligraphy and related arts for several decades. Well-known in the Western calligraphy community, she has taught at international calligraphy conferences as well as at Ghost Ranch, Friends of Calligraphy in San Francisco, Society of Scribes in NYC, La Romita School of Art in Italy, Northern Arizona University, O’Hanlon Center for the Arts, and Sebastopol Center for the Arts. She is the author, illustrator, and designer of "On Softer Ground: Paintings, Poems and Calligraphy", which received a Gold Medal for Most Outstanding Book Design from the Independent Publisher Book Awards. Her newest book, "Distant Voices," features 31 full-color paintings and nine poems, accompanied by an introduction exploring her thoughts and creative process Sherrie exhibits her work in juried shows, solo exhibitions, Art Trails and Art at the Source open studios in Sonoma County. She enjoys teaching both online and in person. www.artandpoetry.com

title: Explore Gel Plate Printing — Sebastopol Center For the Arts, California
location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
Explore Gel Plate Printing

  
    
      
        
          $130.00
        
      
    
  

Saturday, March 28, 2026; 11 AM – 3 PMFee: $115 + $15 materials feeAge: 16+ Participants: min. 8Learn to create beautiful designs on paper by printing with a gel plate and acrylic paint. Mixed media artist Catherine Cruz will teach you the basic skills for using this fun tool from printing textural backgrounds, to layering colors, and using stencils and other applications. You will take home many prints that can be used for designing collage, mixed media art or greeting cards. This class is suitable for anyone wanting to learn this unique mono printing style and perfect for beginners.What you’ll get from this workshop: Methods for applying paint and pulling successful prints (Note: Magazine image transfer is not included in this class.), Techniques for creating intricate layered designs, Creative use of mark-making tools and masks, Strategies for combining techniques.A variety of papers will be provided but you are highly encouraged to bring your own papers to experiment on.IMPORTANT: Instructions for where to purchase your materials and how to prepare them is provided in the attached PDF. The instructor will start the class with a demonstration so please arrive a few minutes early to get set up so we can start on time.  We will take a short break for lunch between 12:30 and 1:00 pm so bring your lunch and a beverage.  About the instructor: Catherine Cruz is a French-American artist whose work is informed by textures and patterns created by the passing of time and the effects of the natural elements on the built environment.  She holds a Bachelor of Science in interior design and she worked in the field of architectural design and green building certification for over 25 years.  She has taught collage and mixed media workshops in the Bay Area and in France since 2019, and this is her fifth year at the Sebastopol Center for the Arts.  Her studio is located in Sebastopol and she participates in Art Trails Open Studios.  You may contact Catherine at beyouartstudio@gmail.com. title: Fresh Pressed Flower Card Workshop
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Jan Lochner
Saturday, March 28th
2:00PM-5:00PM
Santa Rosa Location
$35.00

This is a hands on make and take class where you will make at least five items including a bookmark, a greeting card, a fridge magnet and an ornament. The class will use two different techniques and Jan will explain how to press flowers and which flowers hold their color best. It is a creative experience!


To register for this workshop, please contact Jan at: freshpressedflowercards@yahoo.com mailto:freshpressedflowercards@yahoo.com

Creating note cards from pressed flowers has been Jan’s hobby for 25 years, though she has no formal art training. She utilizes color,
shape and texture on fine quality paper, each card uniquely handmade. Jan’s home in Sebastopol is her studio: the dining room table is her workshop, the kitchen cupboards storing boxes and trays of flowers. She buy card stock by the thousand and pick blooms from her garden and other public places. Her family is used to me saying, “could we stop for just a few minutes so I can gather some… ”

It is a wonderful way of life.

*A note to all students: Please park on in the East facing parking lot while attending classes. We greatly appreciate it. Thank you.

title: Wabi Sabi Ink Painting: Finding Beauty in Imperfection — Sebastopol Center For the Arts, California
location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
Wabi Sabi Ink Painting: Finding Beauty in Imperfection

  
    
      
        
          $165.00
        
      
    
  

Sunday, March 29, 2026; 10am - 4pm$150 + $15 materials feeStep into a creative space where intuition leads and imperfection becomes beauty. This workshop invites you to explore abstract art through both Eastern and Western perspectives, blending meditation, movement, and mark-making to create finished, expressive paintings.Rooted in the Japanese aesthetic of wabi-sabi, we will release the desire for perfection and welcome the unexpected. Discover the quiet magic that happens when ink meets water, when gestures emerge without planning, and when the body and breath guide the brush.The session begins with gentle centering and meditation, allowing you to work from the heart and engage your whole body in the creative process. You will practice painting the ensō—the Zen circle that expresses wholeness, presence, movement, and stillness. Using Asian brushes, ink, and watercolor, you will create calligraphic paintings with layered accents that bring depth, atmosphere, and emotion to your work.Open to all levels. No prior experience required. Ideal for artists, writers, and anyone seeking a mindful, embodied approach to creativity.About the Instructor: Sherrie Lovler holds a BA in Studio Art and has been teaching calligraphy and related arts for several decades. Well-known in the Western calligraphy community, she has taught at international calligraphy conferences as well as at Ghost Ranch, Friends of Calligraphy in San Francisco, Society of Scribes in NYC, La Romita School of Art in Italy, Northern Arizona University, O’Hanlon Center for the Arts, and Sebastopol Center for the Arts. She is the author, illustrator, and designer of "On Softer Ground: Paintings, Poems and Calligraphy", which received a Gold Medal for Most Outstanding Book Design from the Independent Publisher Book Awards. Her newest book, "Distant Voices," features 31 full-color paintings and nine poems, accompanied by an introduction exploring her thoughts and creative process Sherrie exhibits her work in juried shows, solo exhibitions, Art Trails and Art at the Source open studios in Sonoma County. She enjoys teaching both online and in person. www.artandpoetry.com

title: Watercolor Fundamentals Part 1
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Anne Millett

This is a 6-class series, meeting 6 Tuesdays
10:30AM-1:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$270.00


*Additional: Separate $20.00 plus tax Materials Fee paid to Anne at the first class, for the high-quality Arches #140 cold press watercolor paper. Brushes, palettes, high-quality watercolor paint, and set-ups for use during class will be provided.*

There will be a materials fee of $15 plus tax for the series.


Watercolor Fundamentals - Part 1

This class focuses on the simple delight of mixing color with water, brushing it on paper, and watching what happens as it moves and dries. You will learn easy ways to create paintings that are all about color and the sometimes unpredictable nature of water.

No drawing skills are needed.

In this class we will explore the basic principles of watercolor painting. Learn or refresh your understanding of brush handling, brush care and setting up, the benefits of “good paper”, watercolor lights and darks, flat and graded washes, wet-on-wet techniques such as charging, wet-on-dry techniques such as glazing, color wheel, color theory, color mixing, and more. Simple applications of these techniques invite you to experiment and play.

This class is designed for adults 18+

$270 for 6 classes, 2.5 hours each class
Payable via check, cash, or Zelle.

*Brushes, palettes, set-ups, and paint will be provided.*


To see Anne's work and to learn more about this class, please visit her website at: http://www.miraaster.com https://www.miraaster.com/ www.miraaster.com


To register for this workshop, please contact Anne by email at: classes@miraaster.com mailto:classes@miraaster.com mailto:amillett@gmail.com
