title: Observational Drawing 3-Week Course — Sebastopol Center For the Arts, California
location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
Observational Drawing 3-Week Course

  
    
      
        
          $175.00
        
      
    
  

Wednesdays, April 1 - April 15, 2026; 6-9PM$150 + $25 Materials FeeAges 16+In this three week course, participants will learn and practice observational skills and fundamental drawing techniques that will inform all of their other creative pursuits. This course is for anyone who wants to practice and advance their drawing skills - beginners, those who haven’t practiced in years, or any artists who just want to learn more and practice with consistent feedback and guidance. Learning to draw is truly learning to see - a skill that anyone can be taught, practice, and hone. Through demonstration, practice, and reflective discussion, this class will explore the foundations of classical drawing techniques in a low pressure environment. Observational drawing gives all artists a foundation of practical knowledge and skills that infinitely expands the possibilities of what one can create. If your ideas feel limited by your drawing skills, if you feel frustrated or stuck in your painting practice, or if you simply want to start drawing and are looking for a way to begin, this is the class for you. About the Instructor: Hannah Day received her BA in Visual Arts with an emphasis on drawing and printmaking from University of San Diego, then attended University of Hawaii at Manoa to receive her MFA in printmaking. Hannah’s etchings have been internationally shown and collected, but her personal practice also includes paper cutting, graphite, watercolor, mixed media, and murals. She have taught all ages and many formats (kids, teens, adults, college, private lessons, camps, etc) and many mediums. These days Hannah has been teaching primarily paper cutting but also enjoys teaching drawing, painting and printmaking.

description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson
Wednesday, Ongoing
10:00AM-12:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$30.00 per class

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We’ll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

title: Beginning Watercolor Class
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Discover the joy of Watercolor Painting!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‘wet on wet’ watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

Join us and experience the satisfaction of producing your own watercolor masterpieces. Register now and save with our early registration discount!

For more information or to register for this class, please contact Eva at: evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com

You can also visit Eva's website at: http://evamautner.com http://evamautner.com evamautner.com

location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:

          $70.00
        
      
    
  

Thursday, April 2, 2026; 6PM-9PM$60 + $10 Materials feeCreate a whimsical upcycled bouquet using imagination and an assortment of found and recycled papers. In this playful workshop, you’ll learn simple techniques for shaping paper flowers and combining colors, textures, and unexpected materials. No experience needed—just come ready to explore and leave with a one-of-a-kind handmade bouquet. All supplies provided.About the Instructor: Rendell Hourigan received a BBA in Marketing from Texas Tech University, and has pursued art for over 25 years, focusing on sustainable mixed media. She has studied with artists including Chery Baird, Jenny London, and Teri Sloat, exploring drawing, collage, and soft pastels. Her training includes workshops and courses in art journaling, mosaics, and mark-making. She’s exhibited work at the Sebastopol Center for the Arts, The Graton Gallery, and her SOFA district studio. Drawn to the beauty of discarded materials and passionate about recycling, she incorporates reclaimed materials into her work and now leads art workshops to inspire eco-conscious creativity in others.

title: Expressive Portraits
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

To enroll please call or text Suzanne at 707-888-2083

title: Jizo Peace Project: Clay Gathering — Sebastopol Center For the Arts, California
location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
Jizo Peace Project: Clay Gathering for Remembrance and Peace, April

  
    
      
        
          $10.00
        
      
    
  

Friday, April 3, 2026; 1:30 – 4:00pmDue to limited capacity, we are asking for a suggested donation of $10 to confirm your attendance. Bring a copy of your receipt at check-in to Painting/Drawing Studio adjacent to Ceramics StudioJoin us for a monthly, heart-centered gathering where we come together to create Jizo guardians out of clay—symbols of compassion, protection, and peace. Rooted in the Buddhist tradition and echoed across many cultures, Jizo figures traditionally honor children and all who have passed, those in transition, and those in distress.This ongoing project is dedicated to remembering those lost to war, with a special focus now on the approximately 19,000 children who have perished in Israel and Gaza in recent years. Through the simple, meditative act of working with clay, we create benevolent beings that will become part of public exhibits and peace sites, offering spaces for reflection, mourning, and hope. Our gatherings conclude with a gentle ritual to honor the lives of these children.We meet from 1:30–4:00 pm on the first Friday of each month at SebArts, in the Painting & Drawing Room. The gathering is open to ages 12 - adult, and no prior clay experience is necessary—all clay and basic materials are supplied. Registration is required to participate.There is no fee for this class; donations are welcome to help cover materials and expenses. More than a class, this is a shared space of warmth and care—an opportunity to tend to our own hearts while taking part in love in action.

title: Beginning Watercolor Class
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Discover the joy of Watercolor Painting!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‘wet on wet’ watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

Join us and experience the satisfaction of producing your own watercolor masterpieces. Register now and save with our early registration discount!

For more information or to register for this class, please contact Eva at: evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com

You can also visit Eva's website at: http://evamautner.com http://evamautner.com evamautner.com

Let's make beautiful art together!

description:
Back to All Shows


ICON Concerts Presents 
Becky Robinson: The Beasts In Me Tour

Saturday, April 4, 2026

8:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
Originally from Portland, Oregon, Becky Robinson is an LA-based comedian, writer, actor, and voice-over star who has gone from viral sensation to a sold-out theater act. 
You may also know her as the “Entitled Housewife,” the outspoken viral golf character Robinson created to co-star in two self-produced virtual comedy variety specials that helped spread laughter during the pandemic. Her unique character antics and viral videos have racked up millions of views across social media and garnered fans across the country (and the country clubs). In 2022, she released the original song “Mama Needs a Claw.” 


VIP Add-On Option: 

Post Event Meet & Greet



 

THIRD PARTY RESELLERS
Don’t get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. Plus, we’re not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.

title: Beginning Gel Printing Workshop
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Magdalena Bogart
Monday, April 6th
1:00pm-4:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$45.00


Join us for an inspiring gel printing workshop with Magdalena Bogart, where you'll discover the
magic of this versatile and expressive art form. You will learn techniques for creating stunning,
layered prints using gel plates, rich textures, and vibrant colors.
If you have wanted to try out this fairly new and very popular way to make your own papers, whether you are an experienced artist or simply curious about the process, this workshop will provide plenty of creative inspiration and expert insights.

During the 3-hours workshop, you will learn the fundamentals of mono-printing with a gel plate,
including an in-depth look at the essential supplies needed. Magdalena will discuss different
types of plates and brayers, as well as the wide range of acrylic paints and inks. You will learn the basics of color theory to ensure great results for your projects.

You will get to try out many fun techniques on different papers. Magdalena will introduce various papers for gel printing, including white copy paper, calligraphy paper, deli paper, marker paper, and more each offering unique effects.

The workshop will also explore tools for making marks and textures, from found objects to store-bought supplies. Magdalena will demonstrate how to use stencils - both handmade and purchased, along with unconventional tools like silicone scrapers, scrapers, bubble wrap, buttons, yarn, and cardboard to create stunning patterns.

She will also cover techniques to embellish your prints incorporating acrylic pens, Inktense pencils and other techniques.
Additionally, Magdalena will provide expert guidance on cleaning, caring for, and storing gel plates to ensure their longevity. To wrap up the session, she will showcase creative ways to use your printed papers, including ideas for collages, handmade cards, and art journals, along with a take-home list of even more ways to incorporate your gel prints into future projects. Whether you are looking to refine your skills or try something new, this workshop promises to be an engaging and educational experience. Come explore the endless possibilities of gel printing.


To register for this workshop, please contact Magdalena at: 408.781.2589 or by email
at: mailto:mag.bogart@gmail.com mailto:mag.bogart@gmail.com mailto:mag.bogart@gmail.com mailto:mag.bogart@gmail.com mag.bogart@gmail.com mailto:mag.bogart@gmail.com mailto:mag.bogart@gmail.com

title: Watercolor Fundamentals Part 1
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Anne Millett

This is a 6-class series, meeting 6 Tuesdays
10:30AM-1:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$270.00


*Additional: Separate $20.00 plus tax Materials Fee paid to Anne at the first class, for the high-quality Arches #140 cold press watercolor paper. Brushes, palettes, high-quality watercolor paint, and set-ups for use during class will be provided.*

There will be a materials fee of $15 plus tax for the series.


Watercolor Fundamentals - Part 1

This class focuses on the simple delight of mixing color with water, brushing it on paper, and watching what happens as it moves and dries. You will learn easy ways to create paintings that are all about color and the sometimes unpredictable nature of water.

No drawing skills are needed.

In this class we will explore the basic principles of watercolor painting. Learn or refresh your understanding of brush handling, brush care and setting up, the benefits of “good paper”, watercolor lights and darks, flat and graded washes, wet-on-wet techniques such as charging, wet-on-dry techniques such as glazing, color wheel, color theory, color mixing, and more. Simple applications of these techniques invite you to experiment and play.

This class is designed for adults 18+

$270 for 6 classes, 2.5 hours each class
Payable via check, cash, or Zelle.

*Brushes, palettes, set-ups, and paint will be provided.*


To see Anne's work and to learn more about this class, please visit her website at: http://www.miraaster.com https://www.miraaster.com/ www.miraaster.com


To register for this workshop, please contact Anne by email at: classes@miraaster.com mailto:classes@miraaster.com mailto:amillett@gmail.com

title: The Art of Acrylics
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson
Wednesday, Ongoing
10:00AM-12:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$30.00 per class

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We’ll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

title: Beginning Watercolor Class
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Discover the joy of Watercolor Painting!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‘wet on wet’ watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

Join us and experience the satisfaction of producing your own watercolor masterpieces. Register now and save with our early registration discount!

For more information or to register for this class, please contact Eva at: evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com

You can also visit Eva's website at: http://evamautner.com http://evamautner.com evamautner.com

Let's make beautiful art together!

title: Give 'Em the Axe! Ladies Night at the Range in Santa Rosa
description:
Sonoma County Women's Wine Club (SCWWC)
Join us for an axe-throwing session to blow off some steam. I'm super excited to be able to offer a ladies' Axe-throwing night in Santa Rosa. If you've ever had a curiosity about this fun activity, this is your chance to find out more!

We have reserved a group spot with the indoor range on a Wednesday night. It will consist of an introductory lesson, and then we all get to practice taking turns. Everyone will get ample time to practice, as they have many lanes.

This event is focused on a less-competitive, relaxed, and entertaining atmosphere. All skill levels are encouraged. All equipment and targets are provided by them, and we will probably get about 1 to 2 hours to enjoy ourselves.

I encourage everyone to bring a bottle of wine or a snack to share with the rest of the group (We usually end up with a lovely charcuterie and wine spread for everyone to enjoy).

There are 10 spots available, guests welcome. The ladies' group lesson and event is $30 person, paid to the range. Starting March 2025, we ask that every attending member pay a $1 "slush" fund fee per event so that we can build up our funds for club-related expenses, which can be paid by Venmo or cash. There may be standard liability forms to be filled out with the range. Closed-toed shoes are recommended.

Please only RSVP 'Yes' if you are able to make it, I will be doing a final headcount the day of. There is an attendance policy for all our events: if you No-Show to three events, you may not attend events for the next three months. Please put this event in your calendar so you don't miss out or get dinged. A No-Show is when you are on the 'Going' list, but do not show up.

Cheers, and hope to see you there!

location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
This is a monthly on-going class designed to teach beginner or experienced students how to master painting in Acrylics. Students are given a wealth of information regarding acrylic supplies and materials for painting realism or abstraction. At each class, Hines will assist each student in the execution and completion of their painting. Including instructions and demonstrations on color, paint application, color mixing, form and composition. This is a great opportunity for anyone wishing to learn how to paint with acrylics as well as oil painters wishing to transition from oils to acrylics.

Fee:

Sign up for 4 classes: $200 (limited to 10 students)

Limited Drop-ins: $60 per class

title: Expressive Portraits
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

To enroll please call or text Suzanne at 707-888-2083

title: Figure Drawing DROP-IN Session
location: Rileystreet Art Supply (San Rafael),1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Drop-In Figure Drawing session. [San Rafael location]

Fee: $20

This Figure drawing session provides artists with the opportunity to practice drawing techniques with a live model in different poses. This process helps the artist capture the essence of the human body’s posture, texture, and movement.

There is no formal lesson; the sessions run for 3 hours and open to all regardless of experience. First Come First Served.

Long pose, every last Thursday of the month.

Doors open at 6:45pm, front door entry.

All mediums are welcome except oil paint (water soluble oil paint is okay).

title: Beginning Watercolor Class
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Discover the joy of Watercolor Painting!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‘wet on wet’ watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

Join us and experience the satisfaction of producing your own watercolor masterpieces. Register now and save with our early registration discount!

For more information or to register for this class, please contact Eva at: evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com

You can also visit Eva's website at: http://evamautner.com http://evamautner.com evamautner.com

Let's make beautiful art together!

title: Annual Art of Dessert 2026
description:
Back to All Shows



The 23rd Annual Art of Dessert
The Art of Dessert is LBC’s biggest fundraising event of the year. Over the years, it has raised more than $8 million to help provide enrichment in the arts to over 1 million children, families, and educators. 
Much anticipated, spirited, and delicious, The Art of Dessert features sumptuous family-style dining, exceptional Rodney Strong Wine Estates wines, engaging entertainment, a silent and live auction, and, of course, decadent desserts by the best bakers in the county! Bid on unique live auction items and enjoy lively entertainment and engaging speakers. Sonoma County’s best fundraiser is a night to remember, and your support will make a difference for over 50,000 students, teachers, and families in the coming year. 
WHY YOUR SUPPORT MATTERS 
Thanks to your support, Luther Burbank Center for the Arts is the North Bay’s premier arts nonprofit, a vibrant gathering place providing world-class performances, a wide variety of community events, and nationally-recognized education programs that annually serve over 50,000 students, teachers, and families. 
Tickets and more information coming soon! 


Why Your Support Matters
Thanks to your support, Luther Burbank Center for the Arts is the North Bay’s premier arts nonprofit, a vibrant gathering place providing world-class performances, a wide variety of community events, and nationally-recognized education programs that annually serve over 50,000 students, teachers, and families. 
Tickets and more information coming soon! 


Join the Fun – Join the Cause!
There are many ways to get involved with The Art of Dessert and support children, teachers, families, and artists in our community, even from home! 


April 4 – 13, 2026 
Online Auction 
Bid on amazing wine, baskets, gifts, and experiences in the online silent auction.  
If you have an item or experience that you’d like to donate, please contact Barbara Arriaga, Member and Donor Relations, at 707.800.7541 or barriaga@lutherburbankcenter.org 


Sponsorships 
Sponsorships are available for this beloved annual event. Get your name in front of hundreds of the most generous and connected members of the community. 
For more information, contact Ben Taylor, Director of Philanthropy, at 707.800.7505 or btaylor@lutherburbankcenter.org 



We gratefully acknowledge the LBC Naming Sponsor, Lytton Rancheria,
 and Wine Sponsor, Rodney Strong Wine Estates. 


Thank you to our generous Art of Dessert 2026 sponsors! 

 Date: April 11, 2026 
Time: 5:30pm 
Cost: $350 per seat 
Limited number of tickets are available.
Reserve yours by Monday, March 3

title: Watercolor Fundamentals Part 1
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Anne Millett

This is a 6-class series, meeting 6 Tuesdays
10:30AM-1:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$270.00


*Additional: Separate $20.00 plus tax Materials Fee paid to Anne at the first class, for the high-quality Arches #140 cold press watercolor paper. Brushes, palettes, high-quality watercolor paint, and set-ups for use during class will be provided.*

There will be a materials fee of $15 plus tax for the series.


Watercolor Fundamentals - Part 1

This class focuses on the simple delight of mixing color with water, brushing it on paper, and watching what happens as it moves and dries. You will learn easy ways to create paintings that are all about color and the sometimes unpredictable nature of water.

No drawing skills are needed.

In this class we will explore the basic principles of watercolor painting. Learn or refresh your understanding of brush handling, brush care and setting up, the benefits of “good paper”, watercolor lights and darks, flat and graded washes, wet-on-wet techniques such as charging, wet-on-dry techniques such as glazing, color wheel, color theory, color mixing, and more. Simple applications of these techniques invite you to experiment and play.

This class is designed for adults 18+

$270 for 6 classes, 2.5 hours each class
Payable via check, cash, or Zelle.

*Brushes, palettes, set-ups, and paint will be provided.*


To see Anne's work and to learn more about this class, please visit her website at: http://www.miraaster.com https://www.miraaster.com/ www.miraaster.com


To register for this workshop, please contact Anne by email at: classes@miraaster.com mailto:classes@miraaster.com mailto:amillett@gmail.com

title: The Art of Acrylics
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson
Wednesday, Ongoing
10:00AM-12:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$30.00 per class

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We’ll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

This is a monthly on-going class designed to teach beginner or experienced students how to master painting in Acrylics. title: Expressive Portraits
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

To enroll please call or text Suzanne at 707-888-2083

All mediums are welcome except oil paint (water soluble oil paint is okay).

title: Beginning Watercolor Class
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Discover the joy of Watercolor Painting!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‘wet on wet’ watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

Join us and experience the satisfaction of producing your own watercolor masterpieces. Register now and save with our early registration discount!

For more information or to register for this class, please contact Eva at: evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com

You can also visit Eva's website at: http://evamautner.com http://evamautner.com evamautner.com

Let's make beautiful art together!

title: Emmylou Harris
description:
Back to All Shows


Emmylou Harris

Friday, April 17, 2026

8:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
Billboard Century Award recipient, Harris’ contribution as a singer and songwriter spans 40 years. She has recorded more than 25 albums and has lent her talents to countless fellow artists’ recordings. In recognition of her remarkable career, Harris was inducted into the Country Music Hall of Fame in 2008 and earned a Grammy Lifetime Achievement award in 2018. 
Harris is one of the most admired and influential women in music. She has recorded with such diverse artists as Linda Ronstadt, Daniel Lanois, Bob Dylan, Mark Knopfler, Neil Young, Gram Parsons, Willie Nelson, Dolly Parton, Roy Orbison, Ryan Adams, Beck, Elvis Costello, Johnny Cash, Lucinda Williams, Lyle Lovett and Rodney Crowell. Few artists have achieved such honesty or have revealed such maturity in their writing. Forty years into her career, Harris continues to share the hard-earned wisdom that—hopefully if not inevitably—comes with getting older, though she’s never stopped looking ahead.

title: Outback Presents Justin Willman: One for the Ages Tour
description:
Back to All Shows


Outback Presents
Justin Willman: One for the Ages Tour

Saturday, April 18, 2026

7:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
Fresh off the release of Magic Lover, Netflix’s first-ever magic comedy special, Justin Willman is hitting the road with his all-new One for the Ages tour. Willman is best known as the star and creator of Netflix’s Magic for Humans and Magic Prank Show, where his signature mix of mind-blowing magic and relatable humor has made him a streaming favorite, a viral hit (1 billion views and counting), and a fan favorite for families, comedy lovers, and skeptics alike. 
He’s appeared on The Tonight Show, The Today Show, The Kelly Clarkson Show, and Conan, and he was recently named “Stage Magician of the Year” by the Magic Castle. He’s performed at the White House, packed theaters across the country, and managed to make grown adults openly weep over a card trick. But the live show? That’s where the real magic happens. 
One for the Ages is Justin’s biggest tour to date, featuring brand-new material and more. It’s an interactive, laugh-filled, sleight-of-mind experience that’s smart, silly, and astonishing. And yes, it’s the kind of show you can bring your kids, your date, or your dad to. All ages. All generations. All-new. 
This is one for the ages! 


VIP Ticket to include: 

Best available seating
Poster
Post-show Meet & Greet with Justin Willman

title: Ongoing Gel Printing & Collage Workshop
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Magdalena Bogart
Monday, April 20th
1:00PM-4:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$45.00

In my monthly gel-printing & Collage workshop I want to offer
you the opportunity to collage with your handmade papers
starting with an easy project progressing each month to a more
challenging one.

I will demonstrate techniques for making papers with
and without the Gel-Plate. We will create a collection of cohesive
papers. The best of them you will use for your collage project of the month.

Some examples could be fish, a butterfly, a vase with flowers,
a grouping of various cups and more.

Starting with the project in February a requirement is that you
are familiar and comfortable cutting shapes with an X-acto knife
or a similar tool.

To register for this workshop, please contact Magdalena at: 408.781.2589 or by email

title: Watercolor Fundamentals Part 1
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Anne Millett

This is a 6-class series, meeting 6 Tuesdays
10:30AM-1:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$270.00


*Additional: Separate $20.00 plus tax Materials Fee paid to Anne at the first class, for the high-quality Arches #140 cold press watercolor paper. Brushes, palettes, high-quality watercolor paint, and set-ups for use during class will be provided.*

There will be a materials fee of $15 plus tax for the series.


Watercolor Fundamentals - Part 1

This class focuses on the simple delight of mixing color with water, brushing it on paper, and watching what happens as it moves and dries. You will learn easy ways to create paintings that are all about color and the sometimes unpredictable nature of water.

No drawing skills are needed.

In this class we will explore the basic principles of watercolor painting. Learn or refresh your understanding of brush handling, brush care and setting up, the benefits of “good paper”, watercolor lights and darks, flat and graded washes, wet-on-wet techniques such as charging, wet-on-dry techniques such as glazing, color wheel, color theory, color mixing, and more. Simple applications of these techniques invite you to experiment and play.

This class is designed for adults 18+

$270 for 6 classes, 2.5 hours each class
Payable via check, cash, or Zelle.

*Brushes, palettes, set-ups, and paint will be provided.*


To see Anne's work and to learn more about this class, please visit her website at: http://www.miraaster.com https://www.miraaster.com/ www.miraaster.com


To register for this workshop, please contact Anne by email at: classes@miraaster.com mailto:classes@miraaster.com mailto:amillett@gmail.com

title: The Art of Acrylics
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson
Wednesday, Ongoing
10:00AM-12:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$30.00 per class

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We’ll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

title: Beginning Watercolor Class
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Discover the joy of Watercolor Painting!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‘wet on wet’ watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

Join us and experience the satisfaction of producing your own watercolor masterpieces. Register now and save with our early registration discount!

For more information or to register for this class, please contact Eva at: evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com

You can also visit Eva's website at: http://evamautner.com http://evamautner.com evamautner.com

Let's make beautiful art together!

title: Acrylic Painting Workshop
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
This is a monthly on-going class designed to teach beginner or experienced students how to master painting in Acrylics. Students are given a wealth of information regarding acrylic supplies and materials for painting realism or abstraction. At each class, Hines will assist each student in the execution and completion of their painting. Including instructions and demonstrations on color, paint application, color mixing, form and composition. This is a great opportunity for anyone wishing to learn how to paint with acrylics as well as oil painters wishing to transition from oils to acrylics.

Fee:

Sign up for 4 classes: $200 (limited to 10 students)

Limited Drop-ins: $60 per class

To register contact Hines at: mailto:TheArtistHines@gmail.com TheArtistHines@gmail.com mailto:TheArtistHines@gmail.com and receive more information about the class, payment procedure and the class supply list. And please email Hines if you have any questions.

The Artist Hines http://www.hinesfineart.com/ http://www.theartisthinesphotography.com/ https://youtu.be/kfTYYMpar1M

title: Expressive Portraits
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

To enroll please call or text Suzanne at 707-888-2083

On-going, Thursdays
2:00PM-4:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$35.00 Per Class

Join Ann Torrez and learn a few different ways to achieve instant gratification quickly in your drawings and get to the fun part of creating!

Ann will introduce you to a variety of drawing materials and teach you how to use them. You can also expect to explore a variety of different papers, and materials that will aid in transferring your sketch to a more refined, complete piece of artwork.

You can expect a mix of practical tips, upbeat encouragement and a little entertainment that will help you break through mental barriers and hesitations!

title: Clover Sonoma Family Fun Series: Dinosaur World Live
description:
Back to All Shows


Clover Sonoma Family Fun Series
Dinosaur World Live


Thursday, April 23, 2026

6:30 pm


BUY INDIVIDUAL TICKETS 
Dare to experience the dangers and delights of Dinosaur World Live in this Olivier award-winning interactive show for all the family. Adventurers all, grab your compass and join our intrepid explorer across uncharted territories to discover a pre-historic world of astonishing (and remarkably life-like) dinosaurs. Meet a host of impressive creatures, including every child’s favorite flesh-eating giant, the Tyrannosaurus Rex, a Triceratops, Giraffatitan, Microraptor, and Segnosaurus! Don’t miss this entertaining and mind-expanding jurassic adventure, live on stage. 
Recommended for ages 5 and up, however, you know your child best. 
Run Time: 60 minutes
 
Lap passes available day of the show, in-person at the ticket office for ages 2 and under. 

LBC performance may not include pieces from above video. 
 
Family Fun in the Lobby
Starting one hour before each performance, please join us in the lobby for fun art projects uniquely developed for each show. It’s a fun, free way for adults and children alike to get creative, while enhancing your enjoyment of the show. We also have pizza, beverages, and snacks available, all priced with a family’s budget in mind!   


VIPs Meet the Cast
Subscription holders be sure to stick around after the show to meet the cast and get autographs! (Except The Peking Acrobats®.)

title: Figure Drawing DROP-IN Session
location: Rileystreet Art Supply (San Rafael),1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Drop-In Figure Drawing session. [San Rafael location]

Fee: $20

This Figure drawing session provides artists with the opportunity to practice drawing techniques with a live model in different poses. This process helps the artist capture the essence of the human body’s posture, texture, and movement.

There is no formal lesson; the sessions run for 3 hours and open to all regardless of experience. First Come First Served.

Long pose, every last Thursday of the month.

Doors open at 6:45pm, front door entry.

All mediums are welcome except oil paint (water soluble oil paint is okay).

title: Beginning Watercolor Class
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Discover the joy of Watercolor Painting!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‘wet on wet’ watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

Join us and experience the satisfaction of producing your own watercolor masterpieces. Register now and save with our early registration discount!

For more information or to register for this class, please contact Eva at: evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com

You can also visit Eva's website at: http://evamautner.com http://evamautner.com evamautner.com

Let's make beautiful art together!

title: ICON Concerts Presents Gary Owen: No Hard Feelings Tour
description:
Back to All Shows


ICON Concerts Presents
Gary Owen: No Hard Feelings Tour

Friday, April 24, 2026

8:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
Gary Owen has been entertaining audiences for more than two decades with his sharp observational humor and fearless storytelling. Known for his unapologetic, rule-defying style, his material draws from his personal life, time in the military, and the everyday absurdities that connect people across backgrounds. With a fanbase that has grown by the millions in recent months and continues to surge across social media, Owen’s reach has cemented his place as one of the most in-demand touring comedians today. 
Beyond stand-up, Owen has appeared in a wide range of feature films and television. He continues to write, produce, and perform his own groundbreaking comedy specials. In addition to his on-stage and on-screen work, Owen hosts his own podcast, #GetSome with Gary Owen. 
Ages 12+ Recommended

title: Drawing Spring Flowers with Colored Pencil
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Victoria A. Kochergin

April 25, 2026

10:30AM - 3:30PM

Location: Santa Rosa

Fee: $95.00

Spring is here as flowers continue to bloom all around us! What better time to learn how to draw spring flowers with colored pencil. Join this workshop as we delve into drawing spring flowers using colored pencil as a medium. The morning portion of this workshop will focus on colored pencil principles and techniques, student exercises and creating color palettes. The afternoon will be dedicated to hands-on drawing time with individual one-on-one assistance. All levels welcomed. Ability to draw freehand is not needed to participate in this workshop. Materials list to be emailed once registration is completed.

To register, please contact Victoria at kochergi@sonic.net mailto:kochergi@sonic.net mailto:kochergi@sonic.net or (707) 479-3336.

Victoria A. Kochergin is a local botanical artist and instructor who works with colored pencil and acrylics. Her artwork has been exhibited in galleries, wineries, botanical gardens, international shows and on Alcatraz. For more information about Victoria, please visit her website at www.victoriakochergin.com http://www.victoriakochergin.com/

title: Fresh Pressed Flower Card Workshop
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Jan Lochner
Sunday, April 26th
1:00PM-4:00PM
Santa Rosa Location
$35.00

This is a hands on make and take class where you will make at least five items including a bookmark, a greeting card, a fridge magnet and an ornament. The class will use two different techniques and Jan will explain how to press flowers and which flowers hold their color best. It is a creative experience!


To register for this workshop, please contact Jan at: freshpressedflowercards@yahoo.com mailto:freshpressedflowercards@yahoo.com

Creating note cards from pressed flowers has been Jan’s hobby for 25 years, though she has no formal art training. She utilizes color,
shape and texture on fine quality paper, each card uniquely handmade. Jan’s home in Sebastopol is her studio: the dining room table is her workshop, the kitchen cupboards storing boxes and trays of flowers. She buy card stock by the thousand and pick blooms from her garden and other public places. Her family is used to me saying, “could we stop for just a few minutes so I can gather some… ”

It is a wonderful way of life.

*A note to all students: Please park on in the East facing parking lot while attending classes. We greatly appreciate it. Thank you.

title: Symphony Pops: Symphonic Genesis–Tribute to Phil Collins
description:
Back to All Shows


Symphony Pops
Symphonic Genesis–Tribute to Phil Collins
Stuart Chafetz, Guest Conductor
Aaron Finley and Brook Wood, Vocalists
Brian Kushmaul, Drummer


Sunday, April 26, 2026

3:00 pm
2:00 pm Pre-Show Discussion


BUY INDIVIDUAL TICKETS 
 

Phil Collins’ one-of-a-kind drum work and songwriting have left an enduring mark on music. Collins and his Genesis bandmates, Tony Banks and Mike Rutherford, penned unforgettable hits featured in this symphonic tribute. Accompanied by vocalists Aaron Finley and Brook Wood, along with drummer Brian Kushmaul, Guest Conductor Stuart Chafetz will lead some of the best of the best, including “Follow You Follow Me,” “Abacab,” “I Missed Again,” “Turn It On Again,” “Sussudio,” “One More Night,” “Take Me Home,” “Two Hearts,” and the iconic “In the Air Tonight.” 

Generous support provided by Nancy & Michael Hall, Betty & George Ferris

title: The Calder Quartet - SRJC's Chamber Concert Series
location: Glaser Center, 547 Mendocino Avenue Santa Rosa CA
description: Hailed as "superb" and "imaginative, skillful creators" by the New York Times, the Calder Quartet captivates audiences, exploring a broad spectrum of repertoire, always striving to fulfill the composer's vision in its performances. The group's distinctive artistry is exemplified by a musical curiosity brought to everything they perform and has led them to be called "one of America's most satisfying–and most enterprising–quartets."  Winners of the prestigious 2014 Avery Fisher Career Grant, they are widely known for the discovery, commissioning, recording and mentoring of some of today's best emerging composers.  Benjamin Jacobson, violin; Tereza Stanislav, violin; Jonathan Moerschel, viola; and Eric Byers, cello     Program:  Philip Glass, String Quartet No. 2, "Company"  Ben Johnston, String Quartet No. 4, "Amazing Grace"  Samuel Barber, String Quartet in B minor Op. 11  Andrew Norman, Sabrina (arr. for string quartet)  Florence Price, String Quartet No. 2*Reception immediately following concert     Ticket Prices:  Season tickets (all 6 concerts): $155  Mini Season (any 3 concerts): $90  Individual tickets: $35  Student tickets (with valid ID): $20   Buy tickets here! title: Sonoma State Rep - In Person Appointments (Santa Rosa)
Watercolor Fundamentals Part 1
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Anne Millett

This is a 6-class series, meeting 6 Tuesdays
10:30AM-1:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$270.00


*Additional: Separate $20.00 plus tax Materials Fee paid to Anne at the first class, for the high-quality Arches #140 cold press watercolor paper. Brushes, palettes, high-quality watercolor paint, and set-ups for use during class will be provided.*

There will be a materials fee of $15 plus tax for the series.


Watercolor Fundamentals - Part 1

This class focuses on the simple delight of mixing color with water, brushing it on paper, and watching what happens as it moves and dries. You will learn easy ways to create paintings that are all about color and the sometimes unpredictable nature of water.

No drawing skills are needed.

In this class we will explore the basic principles of watercolor painting. Learn or refresh your understanding of brush handling, brush care and setting up, the benefits of “good paper”, watercolor lights and darks, flat and graded washes, wet-on-wet techniques such as charging, wet-on-dry techniques such as glazing, color wheel, color theory, color mixing, and more. Simple applications of these techniques invite you to experiment and play.

This class is designed for adults 18+

$270 for 6 classes, 2.5 hours each class
Payable via check, cash, or Zelle.

*Brushes, palettes, set-ups, and paint will be provided.*


To see Anne's work and to learn more about this class, please visit her website at: http://www.miraaster.com https://www.miraaster.com/ www.miraaster.com


To register for this workshop, please contact Anne by email at: classes@miraaster.com mailto:classes@miraaster.com mailto:amillett@gmail.com

title: The Art of Acrylics
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson
Wednesday, Ongoing
10:00AM-12:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$30.00 per class

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We’ll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

title: Expressive Portraits
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

To enroll please call or text Suzanne at 707-888-2083

title: THIRSTY THURSDAY New Member Social for Sonoma County Women's Wine Club
description:
Sonoma County Women's Wine Club (SCWWC)
This is our regular club meeting, held on the last Thursday of every month except for holidays and we are super excited! Come join us at 4th Street Cellars in downtown Santa Rosa. They have generously offered to host our monthly THIRSTY THURSDAY social for us.

If you are new to the area, or just looking to get out of the house and make new friends, this is the place for you. Welcoming to ALL new and (ahem, old) members.

Wine is purchased by the glass for a set fee of $13/$14 per glass with the variety of white, rosé, and red wines offered through 4th Street Cellars which includes tip. Fees are collected at the venue by Co-organizer Daima Phipps via cash, Venmo, or Paypal. You are welcome to purchase wine separately if you choose. Starting March 2025, we ask that every attending member pay a $1 "slush" fund fee per event so that we can build up our funds for club-related expenses, which can be paid by Venmo or cash.

There is no food offered, but you are welcome to bring an appetizer or snack to share with the group, and many ladies do. We will have time to socialize while tasting in the room upstairs to the left or the outside patio if the weather is nice.

The space has a 25 person attendee limit, but the list is open to 40 to eliminate a waitlist, and guests are welcome! Please RSVP below only if you are able to make it, we have an attendance policy: if you No-Show to three events, you may not attend events for the next three months. Please put this event in your calendar so you don't miss out or get dinged. A No-Show is when you are on the 'Going' list, but do not show up.

See you there, ready to kickoff!

title: Beginning Watercolor Class
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Discover the joy of Watercolor Painting!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‘wet on wet’ watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

Join us and experience the satisfaction of producing your own watercolor masterpieces. Register now and save with our early registration discount!

For more information or to register for this class, please contact Eva at: evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com

You can also visit Eva's website at: http://evamautner.com http://evamautner.com evamautner.com

Let's make beautiful art together!

title: Clover Sonoma Family Fun Series: Ada Twist, Scientist & Friends by TheaterWorksUSA
description:
Back to All Shows


Clover Sonoma Family Fun Series
Ada Twist, Scientist & Friends
by TheaterWorksUSA


Sunday, May 3, 2026

3:30 pm


BUY INDIVIDUAL TICKETS 
When Ms. Greer’s classroom field trip goes awry, three out-of-the-box thinkers must pull their STEM skills together to save the day! Meet Rosie Revere and her engineering dreams, Iggy Peck, with her relentless passion for architecture, and Ada Twist, whose science curiosity leads her to some adventurous problem solving. In this live musical performance, our heroes face the ultimate test of their problem-solving skills—a test that can only be conquered through teamwork. Don’t miss this fun musical based on the Andrea Beaty books, Rosie Revere, Engineer; Iggy Peck, Architect, and Ada Twist, Scientist, which spotlight the STEM curriculum (focusing on science, technology, engineering and math). 
Recommended for ages 5-9, however, you know your child best. 
Run Time: 60 minutes 
Lap passes available day of the show, in-person at the ticket office for ages 2 and under. 

LBC performance may not include pieces from above video. 
 
Family Fun in the Lobby
Starting one hour before each performance, please join us in the lobby for fun art projects uniquely developed for each show. It’s a fun, free way for adults and children alike to get creative, while enhancing your enjoyment of the show. We also have pizza, beverages, and snacks available, all priced with a family’s budget in mind!   


VIPs Meet the Cast
Subscription holders be sure to stick around after the show to meet the cast and get autographs! (Except The Peking Acrobats®.) 

 Family Fun Series – Save 20% and see all 5 shows!
See the full series here: Clover Sonoma Family Fun Series 



Timeline

New Subscriptions go on sale for Members beginning June 24; General Public, June 27.
Individual Tickets go on sale for Members beginning August 19; General Public, August 22.

Two ways to buy! Season ticket packages are available online or by downloading the form (linked below) and sending the completed form to us by mail or email. If you have any questions, call the Patron & Member Services Office at 707.546.3600. 

Purchase New Subscription ONLINE

title: Watercolor Fundamentals Part 1
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Anne Millett

This is a 6-class series, meeting 6 Tuesdays
10:30AM-1:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$270.00


*Additional: Separate $20.00 plus tax Materials Fee paid to Anne at the first class, for the high-quality Arches #140 cold press watercolor paper. Brushes, palettes, high-quality watercolor paint, and set-ups for use during class will be provided.*

There will be a materials fee of $15 plus tax for the series.


Watercolor Fundamentals - Part 1

This class focuses on the simple delight of mixing color with water, brushing it on paper, and watching what happens as it moves and dries. You will learn easy ways to create paintings that are all about color and the sometimes unpredictable nature of water.

No drawing skills are needed.

In this class we will explore the basic principles of watercolor painting. Learn or refresh your understanding of brush handling, brush care and setting up, the benefits of “good paper”, watercolor lights and darks, flat and graded washes, wet-on-wet techniques such as charging, wet-on-dry techniques such as glazing, color wheel, color theory, color mixing, and more. Simple applications of these techniques invite you to experiment and play.

This class is designed for adults 18+

$270 for 6 classes, 2.5 hours each class
Payable via check, cash, or Zelle.

*Brushes, palettes, set-ups, and paint will be provided.*


To see Anne's work and to learn more about this class, please visit her website at: http://www.miraaster.com https://www.miraaster.com/ www.miraaster.com


To register for this workshop, please contact Anne by email at: classes@miraaster.com mailto:classes@miraaster.com mailto:amillett@gmail.com

description:

-Free Admission - Refreshments - Open to the public -

Topic to be announced.....
Speaker to be announced......

About the Santa Rosa Pronaos
We hold a monthly public presentation on mystical or metaphysical topics as a public service. The topics and speakers vary and no previous knowledge or experience is required. Just bring an open mind and heart.

The Santa Rosa Pronaos doesn't charge for admission. We operate under the law of AMRA. You may give as your heart and mind direct you.

The Santa Rosa Pronaos of the Rosicrucian Order, AMORC is a 501c3 Educational Nonprofit.

title: The Art of Acrylics
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson
Wednesday, Ongoing
10:00AM-12:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$30.00 per class

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We’ll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

title: An Evening with David Sedaris
description:
Back to All Shows


David Sedaris

Friday, May 8, 2026

8:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
David Sedaris is one of America’s pre-eminent humor writers. He is a master of satire and one of today’s most observant writers. 
Beloved for his personal essays and short stories, David Sedaris is the author of the New York Times bestsellers Barrel Fever, Holidays on Ice, Naked, Me Talk Pretty One Day, Dress Your Family in Corduroy and Denim, When You Are Engulfed in Flames, Let’s Explore Diabetes with Owls, and Calypso. His book, The Best of Me, collects 42 previously published stories and essays. Sedaris also wrote Squirrel Seeks Chipmunk: A Modest Bestiary, a collection of fables with illustrations by Ian Falconer. He is the editor of Children Playing Before a Statue of Hercules: An Anthology of Outstanding Stories. His pieces regularly appear in The New Yorker and have twice been included in “The Best American Essays.”

title: Bobby Rush & North Mississippi Allstars
description:
Back to All Shows


Bobby Rush & North Mississippi Allstars

Saturday, May 9, 2026

8:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
Modern Mississippi Hill Country band North Mississippi Allstars and blues legend Bobby Rush are co-headlining this unique event, with each artist performing separately before joining together to honor their Mississippi blues roots. 
North Mississippi Allstars was started by brothers Luther and Cody Dickinson in 1996 as a loose collective of musicians from their North Mississippi home. They were inspired by their father Jim Dickinson as well as neighbors and musical elders of their community, including RL Burnside, Junior Kimbrough, Otha Turner, and Fred McDowell. They have multiple Grammy® nominations for their acclaimed experimental albums, and the latest album, Still Shakin’, is out now. 
The 91-year-old Bobby Rush is a three-time Grammy Award® winner for “Best Traditional Blues Album” for Porcupine Meat, Rawer than Raw, and 2024’s All My Love for You. He is also a 16-time Blues Music Awards winner (with 56 career nominations) and has been inducted into the Blues Hall of Fame, Mississippi Musicians Hall of Fame and Rhythm & Blues Hall of Fame.

location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Anne Millett

This is a 6-class series, meeting 6 Tuesdays
10:30AM-1:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$270.00


*Additional: Separate $20.00 plus tax Materials Fee paid to Anne at the first class, for the high-quality Arches #140 cold press watercolor paper. Brushes, palettes, high-quality watercolor paint, and set-ups for use during class will be provided.*

There will be a materials fee of $15 plus tax for the series.


Watercolor Fundamentals - Part 1

This class focuses on the simple delight of mixing color with water, brushing it on paper, and watching what happens as it moves and dries. You will learn easy ways to create paintings that are all about color and the sometimes unpredictable nature of water.

No drawing skills are needed.

In this class we will explore the basic principles of watercolor painting. Learn or refresh your understanding of brush handling, brush care and setting up, the benefits of “good paper”, watercolor lights and darks, flat and graded washes, wet-on-wet techniques such as charging, wet-on-dry techniques such as glazing, color wheel, color theory, color mixing, and more. Simple applications of these techniques invite you to experiment and play.

This class is designed for adults 18+

$270 for 6 classes, 2.5 hours each class
Payable via check, cash, or Zelle.

*Brushes, palettes, set-ups, and paint will be provided.*


To see Anne's work and to learn more about this class, please visit her website at: http://www.miraaster.com https://www.miraaster.com/ www.miraaster.com


To register for this workshop, please contact Anne by email at: classes@miraaster.com mailto:classes@miraaster.com mailto:amillett@gmail.com

title: The Art of Acrylics
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson
Wednesday, Ongoing
10:00AM-12:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$30.00 per class

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We’ll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

title: Beginning Watercolor Class
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Discover the joy of Watercolor Painting!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‘wet on wet’ watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

Join us and experience the satisfaction of producing your own watercolor masterpieces. Register now and save with our early registration discount!

For more information or to register for this class, please contact Eva at: evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com

title: Expressive Portraits
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

To enroll please call or text Suzanne at 707-888-2083

title: Napoleon Dynamite Live - A Conversation with Jon Heder, Efren Ramirez, and Jon Gries
description:
Back to All Shows


Napoleon Dynamite Live
A Conversation with Jon Heder, Efren Ramirez, and Jon Gries


Friday, May 15, 2026

7:30 pm


BUY TICKETS 
Since the release of the beloved indie classic, Napoleon Dynamite, 20 years ago, much has changed, but the characters, as enduring as they are endearing, stay in our hearts. This unique evening includes a full screening of Napoleon Dynamite, followed by a lively discussion with cast members, Jon Heder (Napoleon Dynamite), Jon Gries (Uncle Rico), and Efren Ramirez (Pedro). Perfect for the whole family, this live show is a wild and hysterical blend of Q&A, comedy improv, game show, and party, with plenty of audience participation. 


VIP Meet and Greet Add-On Option: 
Elevate your event experience with this exclusive chance to meet Jon Heder (Napoleon), Efren Ramirez (Pedro), and Jon Gries (Uncle Rico), including a photo opportunity. With limited tickets available, be sure to reserve yours soon! 


 

THIRD PARTY RESELLERS
Don’t get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. Plus, we’re not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.
